doc.title: Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: FR026: Web-based admin UI for configuration management. FR027: Real-time status dashboard. FR028: Tenant management CRUD. FR029: Enhancement history filtering. FR030: System operations controls. FR031: Worker health metrics. FR032: Form-based config editing. FR033: Search functionality.

doc.title: Architecture Document
doc.section: ADR-009: Streamlit for Admin UI, Epic 6 Implementation
doc.snippet: Streamlit 1.30+ chosen for admin UI (Epic 6). Rationale: Python-native, 5-10x faster development than React, perfect for ops tools. Independent Streamlit app (src/admin/app.py) with K8s service on port 8501.

doc.title: Admin UI Setup Guide (Story 6.1)
doc.snippet: Existing 422-line setup guide covering foundation, basic structure, authentication, database connectivity. Created in Story 6.1. Covers local dev setup and K8s deployment basics. Story 6.8 creates comprehensive replacement covering all 6 pages (6.2-6.7).

doc.title: Product Epics Document
doc.section: Epic 6: Admin UI & Configuration Management, Story 6.8
doc.snippet: Epic 6 added for MVP v1.5 (2025-11-02). Story 6.8: Create comprehensive documentation for admin UI covering all features from Stories 6.1-6.7.

doc.title: Story 6.1: Streamlit Foundation
doc.snippet: Multi-page navigation, session-based auth, shared database models, dual-mode authentication (dev/prod), production-ready foundation for Stories 6.2-6.7.

doc.title: Story 6.2: System Status Dashboard
doc.snippet: Real-time metrics cards (database status, active tenants, queue depth, success rate), system health indicators, auto-refresh with @st.fragment, performance-optimized caching.

doc.title: Story 6.3: Tenant Management
doc.snippet: CRUD operations, Fernet encryption for secrets, ServiceDesk Plus API integration, validation, 127 tests passing. Production-ready tenant management interface.

doc.title: Story 6.4: Enhancement History Viewer
doc.snippet: Filters (tenant/status/date/search), pagination, expandable details (JSON/text/errors), CSV export, composite index for query optimization, custom pagination patterns.

doc.title: Story 6.5: System Operations Controls
doc.snippet: Pause/resume processing, queue management (clear/inspect), tenant sync, worker restart, confirmation dialogs, status indicators, comprehensive operations helper modules.

doc.title: Story 6.6: Real-Time Metrics
doc.snippet: Prometheus HTTP API integration, interactive Plotly charts (Queue Depth, Success Rate, Latency P50/P95/P99), time range selector (1h/6h/24h/7d), 60s auto-refresh, cached data fallback.

doc.title: Story 6.7: Worker Monitoring
doc.snippet: Celery inspect API (ping/stats/active), Prometheus metrics (CPU%/Memory%/throughput), K8s operations (graceful restart, logs), 7-day charts, 30s auto-refresh, RBAC requirements (ServiceAccount, Role, RoleBinding in k8s/streamlit-rbac.yaml).

doc.title: 2025 Technical Documentation Best Practices
doc.snippet: Progressive disclosure: Quick Start first, detailed sections follow. Use headings, bullet points, visual aids (screenshots/diagrams). Role-based organization for different audiences. Clear language, avoid jargon, include glossary. Practical real-life examples. Good search function. Maintain quarterly reviews.

doc.title: Streamlit Kubernetes Deployment 2025
doc.snippet: Official Streamlit K8s tutorial at docs.streamlit.io/deploy/tutorials/kubernetes. Docker containerization with dependencies. ConfigMap and Deployment setup. LoadBalancer service type (port 80 → targetPort 8501). OAuth2-Proxy sidecar for authentication. Scaling via replica configuration. Cloud provider monitoring tools.

constraints.constraint: Documentation-only story - NO code changes required. All acceptance criteria (AC1-AC8) are documentation deliverables. Do not modify Python code, K8s manifests, or configuration files.

Story creates NEW comprehensive admin-ui-guide.md (800-1000 lines estimated) that SUPERSEDES existing admin-ui-setup.md. Do NOT delete admin-ui-setup.md (may have external links). Note the supersession in new guide.

Documentation must serve TWO audiences: (1) Developers - local dev setup, architecture understanding, configuration options, (2) Operations Engineers - K8s deployment, troubleshooting, security hardening. Use progressive disclosure structure.

Screenshots/wireframes REQUIRED for all 6 pages (Dashboard, Tenants, History, Operations, Metrics, Workers). Decision for MVP: Use annotated wireframes (placeholder screenshots). Actual screenshots in future update.

CRITICAL for K8s deployment documentation: k8s/streamlit-rbac.yaml MUST be applied BEFORE streamlit-admin-deployment.yaml. Worker Monitoring page will NOT function without proper RBAC permissions (ServiceAccount: streamlit-admin, Role: pods/logs/deployments access).

Follow 2025 documentation best practices from web research: progressive disclosure (Quick Start → detailed sections), visual aids (screenshots/diagrams/tables), clear language (no jargon without definitions), practical examples (real commands), role-based organization, searchable structure (clear headers).

Document 2025 Streamlit deployment patterns: Docker containerization, K8s ConfigMap/Deployment/Service/Ingress, LoadBalancer service (port 80 → 8501), NGINX basic auth (OAuth2-Proxy future enhancement), scaling via replicas, monitoring tools.

Kubernetes deployment instructions must cover: Prerequisites (K8s 1.28+, kubectl, NGINX Ingress), Docker image build, Authentication setup (setup-streamlit-auth.sh), Manifest deployment order (RBAC → ConfigMap → Deployment → Service → Ingress), Verification commands, Local access configuration (/etc/hosts).

Troubleshooting section MUST include 6+ common issues with step-by-step solutions: Database connection failures, Authentication issues (K8s), Worker monitoring not loading (RBAC), Pod crashes, WebSocket connection lost, Port conflicts (local). Include diagnostic commands and expected outputs.

Security considerations MUST cover: Authentication methods (basic auth vs OAuth2 future), Secrets management (K8s secrets, env vars, rotation), Network security (ingress annotations, TLS), Database access (RLS, pooling), Audit logging (NGINX, application, K8s), Production hardening checklist.

interface.name: Streamlit Multi-Page Navigation
interface.reason: Document multi-page navigation pattern used throughout admin UI. Each page is a separate Python file in src/admin/pages/. Main app.py handles routing.

interface.name: Database Connection (Synchronous)
interface.signature: AI_AGENTS_DATABASE_URL environment variable, SQLAlchemy synchronous session
interface.reason: Document database configuration. Separate from async FastAPI layer. Connection string format: postgresql+psycopg2://user:pass@host:port/dbname. Connection pooling configurable.

interface.name: Kubernetes RBAC for Worker Operations
interface.reason: CRITICAL interface for Worker Monitoring page (Story 6.7). Document RBAC requirements: pods (get/list/watch/delete), pods/log (get/list), deployments (get/list/patch). Must apply manifest before deployment.

interface.name: NGINX Ingress Basic Authentication
interface.reason: Document production authentication setup. Basic auth via NGINX Ingress annotations. Secret created with scripts/setup-streamlit-auth.sh (htpasswd format). Future enhancement: OAuth2-Proxy.

interface.name: Prometheus HTTP API
interface.reason: Document Prometheus integration for Real-Time Metrics page (Story 6.6). Query metrics: queue depth, success rate, latency percentiles. Cached data fallback if unavailable.

interface.name: Celery Inspect API
interface.reason: Document Celery worker inspection for Worker Monitoring page (Story 6.7). Used to discover workers, check health, get active tasks. Configuration: CELERY_APP_NAME environment variable.

tests.standards: This is a documentation-only story (Constraint C1) with NO code changes. Traditional unit/integration tests are not applicable. Testing for Story 6.8 consists of DOCUMENTATION VALIDATION: (1) Manual testing: Follow documented steps in clean environment to verify accuracy, (2) Command verification: Execute all commands in documentation to ensure they work, (3) Link validation: Check all internal and external links are accessible, (4) Technical accuracy: Cross-reference documentation against actual code/manifests, (5) Peer review: Get team member review or self-review after 24 hours, (6) Checklist validation: Use admin-ui-deployment-checklist.md to verify completeness.
tests.locations: - docs/admin-ui-guide.md (primary deliverable, 800-1000 lines) - docs/admin-ui-deployment-checklist.md (deployment validation checklist) - README.md (Quick Links section updated) - docs/index.md (navigation link added if exists)

ideas.idea: Validate admin-ui-guide.md structure: Verify sections exist (Overview, Access, Features, Configuration). Check table of contents completeness. Verify progressive disclosure pattern (Quick Start → detailed sections). Validate internal anchor links work.

Test local development setup instructions: Follow setup steps on clean environment (Python 3.12+, PostgreSQL). Verify all commands execute without errors. Test database connection with provided connection string format. Verify authentication setup with .streamlit/secrets.toml. Confirm app starts with `streamlit run src/admin/app.py`.

Test Kubernetes deployment instructions: Verify prerequisite checks (K8s 1.28+, kubectl, NGINX Ingress). Test Docker image build command. Execute setup-streamlit-auth.sh script. Apply manifests in documented order (RBAC → ConfigMap → Deployment → Service → Ingress). Run verification commands. Test /etc/hosts configuration. Verify app accessible via ingress.

Validate screenshots/wireframes: Verify wireframes/placeholders exist for all 6 pages (Dashboard, Tenants, History, Operations, Metrics, Workers). Check annotations are clear and highlight key features. Verify captions explain each visual ("Figure 1: Dashboard page showing..."). Ensure images directory structure exists (docs/images/admin-ui/).

Test troubleshooting section: Verify 6+ common issues documented. Test diagnostic commands for each issue (e.g., `echo $AI_AGENTS_DATABASE_URL`, `kubectl get pods`). Follow solutions step-by-step. Verify expected outputs are shown. Check that solutions resolve actual issues.

Validate security considerations: Verify authentication methods documented (basic auth vs OAuth2). Check secrets management guidance (K8s secrets, rotation schedule). Verify network security section (ingress annotations, TLS). Check database access documentation (RLS, pooling). Validate audit logging section (NGINX, application, K8s). Review production hardening checklist completeness.

Validate future enhancements: Verify 5+ enhancement items documented (OAuth2-Proxy, RBAC, audit logs UI, TLS automation, custom alerting, advanced dashboards, multi-cluster). Check each has description and estimated effort. Verify items align with post-MVP roadmap.

Test README.md update: Verify Quick Links section contains "Admin UI Guide" link. Check link points to docs/admin-ui-guide.md. Validate description is comprehensive. Test all other README links still work. Verify formatting consistency with existing links.

Documentation completeness validation: Run spell check and grammar check. Verify technical accuracy by cross-referencing with code (src/admin/), manifests (k8s/streamlit-*), and story files (6.1-6.7). Check all file paths referenced actually exist. Validate all internal links work (#overview, #features, etc.). Ensure formatting consistency (headers, code blocks, tables). Verify Google-style documentation standards (clear language, no unexplained jargon).

Test deployment checklist: Follow admin-ui-deployment-checklist.md step-by-step. Verify Pre-Deployment checklist items are actionable. Test Build & Push commands. Follow Configuration checklist. Execute Deployment steps. Run Verification checks. Review Security Hardening items. Complete Post-Deployment tasks. Ensure all checkbox items are clear and testable.
